newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore shares open up, cheap stocks get boost.
newsitem.headline: Singapore shares open up, cheap stocks get boost.

text.p: Singapore stocks were firmer at mid-morning on Wednesday with low-priced counters getting a boost from the glitter of newly-listed shares.
"It is a follow-through firmness from the last few days performances," a dealer said. "Investors are taking a second look at these new counters and small capitalised stocks."
Topping the actives were mostly recently listed shares like SMB United, Advanced Systems Automation, Labroy Marine, Delifrance, Dovechem, Presscrete and NatSteel Broadway.
SMB United and Advanced Systems Automation topped the actives with nine million and eight million shares respectively.
Cheap and small-capitalised stocks, including electronic counters like Aztech Systems, Eltech Electronics and Sunright, rode on the back of better sentiment of newly listed companies.
At 0230 GMT, the Straits Times Industrials Index was up 15.61 points at 2,054.45. Turnover was light at 59 million shares, with gainers leading losers at 164 to 27.
Malaysian Resources led the gainers, rising Singapore $0.40 (US$0.28) to S$5.85. Other gainers were foreign counters of OCBC, DBS and UOB, all up by S$0.20-0.30.
Malaysian MISC Foreign and Sime Darby shed S$0.08 and S$0.05 respectively to S$4.26 and S$4.54.
